choices: When the task starts, on each page, you will see a prompt that a user may ask to an AI chatbot. Below the prompt, you will see two responses, Response A and Response B, generated by a chatbot. You will pick which response is better, in your opinion.

choices: Please note, there will be 3-5 attention checks interspersed throughout the task. The attention checks will have normal prompts, but one of the two responses will be completely irrelevant to the prompt. The other response will be clearly relevant to the prompt, and so you should select the relevant response as the better response. If you select the irrelevant response in multiple attention checks, we will conclude that you are not reading the responses, and your submission may be rejected.

Please note that if annotators take an abnormally short time to complete the task or appear to randomly guess between options, their submission risks being rejected. This measure is to ensure the integrity of the task and will only affect annotators who are clearly performing the task in bad faith. If you are performing the task as well as you can after carefully reading the prompts and responses, your submission will not be rejected.

If you would like, you can use the keyboard to perform the annotation task instead of clicking with your mouse. The left arrow will move backward (previous question) and the right arrow will move forward (next question).
To select your answer, you can use keys 1-4 to select possible answers; the instructions on the task page will display which choice each number on the keyboard corresponds to.
